data.title: UEFA Europa League, Conference League draw for quarter
data.meta_description: When is the Europa League quarter-final draw? When is the semi-final draw? How does it work? Could Liverpool and West Ham face each other in quarter-finals?
data.text:
The quarter-final participants for the UEFA Europa League and UEFA Europa Conference League have been decided following the conclusion of the round of 16 ties.

In the Europa League, Liverpool cruised through courtesy of an emphatic 11-2 aggregate win over Sparta Prague having smashed the Czech side 6-1 in the second leg at Anfield.

Joining them in the last eight will be West Ham who overturned a 1-0 first leg deficit at the London Stadium to crush Frieburg 5-0 in a match lit up by .

Premier League

Klopp pays tribute to fans, 'the superpower of world football,' in emotional farewell speech

19/05/2024 at 19:07

AC Milan and Bayer Leverkusen also have their sights on winning the Europa League.

Aston Villa's comprehensive 4-0 second leg victory over Ajax saw them book their place in the last eight of the Europa Conference League.

When are the draws for the quarter-finals of the Europa League and Conference League? And could Premier League clubs be drawn against each other?

We run through everything you need to know…

When are the Europa League and Conference League quarter-final draws?

The draw for the quarter-finals of the Europa League will take place at midday UK time on Friday, March 15 in Nyon, Switzerland.

It will be followed by the Conference League quarter-final draw from 1pm, with the Champions League quarter-final draw at 11am.

The semi-final routes will also be plotted out at the same time.

You can watch the draws for both competitions live on the TNT Sports YouTube channel.

How do the draws work?

There are no seedings or country protection restrictions for the quarter-final draws so any of the eight teams could be drawn against each other.

That means Premier League rivals Liverpool and West Ham could meet in the Europa League quarter-finals.

How to watch the quarter-final draws

The Europa League and Conference League quarter-final and semi-final draws will be shown live on TNT Sports on Friday, March 15.

TNT Sports is available across all major TV platforms, offering a line-up of up to four TV channels (TNT Sports 1, TNT Sports 2, TNT Sports 3, TNT Sports 4), and up to six digital or red-button channels (TNT Sports 5 to 10), and TNT Sports Ultimate plus TNT Sports Box Office HD.

You can subscribe to TNT Sports through discovery+, BT, EE, Sky, and Virgin Media.

The draws will also be available to stream via the TNT Sports YouTube channel.

Who is in the Europa League quarter-finals?

The full line up for the Europa League quarter-finals was confirmed following the second legs of the round of 16 ties:

AC Milan (Italy)

Atalanta (Italy)

Bayer Leverkusen (Germany)

Benfica (Portugal)

Liverpool (England)

Marseille (France)

Roma (Italy)

West Ham (England)

Who’s in the Conference League quarter-finals?

Aston Villa (England)

Club Bruges (Belgium)

Fenerbahce (Turkey)

Fiorentina (Italy)

Lille (France)

Olympiakos (Greece)

PAOK (Greece)

Viktoria Plzen (Czech Republic)

When are the Europa League quarter-finals and semi-finals?

The two-legged Europa League and Conference League quarter-finals will be held on April 11 and 18.

The two legs of the semi-finals will be played on May 2 and 9.

The Europa League final will be held at the Dublin Arena in Dublin, Ireland on May 22.

The Conference League will be staged at the AEK Arena in Athens, Greece on May 29.

How do I watch Europa League live streams on TNT Sports? What is discovery+?

The streaming home for TNT Sports in the UK is discovery+, where fans can enjoy a subscription that includes TNT Sports, Eurosport and entertainment in one destination.

You can also watch TNT Sports through BT, EE, Sky, and Virgin Media.

- - -

TNT Sports presents the premium live sports rights previously carried by BT Sport including the Premier League, UEFA Champions League, UEFA Europa League, UEFA Conference League, Gallagher Premiership Rugby, Investec Champions Cup, EPCR Challenge Cup, MotoGP, Cricket, UFC, Boxing and WWE.
